definition: to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length

sentences.english: My original intention was to make clothing for amputees.
sentences.chinese: 我的初衷是给截肢者做衣服。

sentences.english: Peng Shuilin had half of his body amputated after being run over by a truck.
sentences.chinese: 彭水林被一辆卡车辗过，一半身体被截肢后。

sentences.english: Many untreated wounds are becoming infected, leading to amputations.
sentences.chinese: 许多未经治疗的伤员正遭受感染，会导致截肢。

sentences.english: The researchers reported that 115 people had lower-limb amputations attributed to diabetes.
sentences.chinese: 该研究指出有115人由于糖尿病而导致下肢截肢。

sentences.english: They were hanged up bad, severe lacerations, amputees, a lot of shrapnel.
sentences.chinese: 严重的爆炸造成严重伤亡，截肢，很多弹片。

sentences.english: Demonstrate ability to manage amputation injuries and discuss the potential for reimplantation .
sentences.chinese: 有能处截肢性创伤与讨再接合的可能性。

sentences.english: The conventional treatment of osteogenic sarcoma is a high amputation as well as disarticulation.
sentences.chinese: 骨肉瘤的传统疗法是高位截肢，关节离断。

sentences.english: At that point, the decision was made to amputate.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，决定把截肢。

sentences.english: And if you can't counter the infection, they can amputate at once.
sentences.chinese: 如果你抵抗不了感染，他们可以马上给你做截肢手术。

sentences.english: Two patients underwent a secondary below-knee amputation half a year later for the reason of intractable pain.
sentences.chinese: 两位病患在半年后因疼痛而接受膝下截肢。

sentences.english: This can, in turn, lead to more complications such as infection or amputation.
sentences.chinese: 这就可能，反过来，导致更多并发症，如感染或截肢。

sentences.english: This means that the patient has developed problems that are putting the leg at risk of amputation.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着病人已经有截肢的危险了。

sentences.english: It is also a leading cause of blindness, amputations, and loss of kidney function.
sentences.chinese: 糖尿病也是失明，截肢及肾功能丧失的主要原因。

sentences.english: The aquarium has established a program that allows amputees to visit for free.
sentences.chinese: 该水族馆还启动了一个项目，允许截肢人士免费参观。

sentences.english: They are limbless and often depicted as cobra-like in movement.
sentences.chinese: 他们是截肢，往往描绘成眼镜蛇样的运动。

definition: disabled/handicapped/deformity on a person or animal
to suffer a fracture/(of a bone) to break/fracture
to be crippled (in an accident etc)
to lose one's eyesight/to become blind/blindness
paralysis of one side of the body/hemiplegia
to injure oneself in a fall
paralysis of one side of the body/hemiplegia
